entry.title: French parliament urges sanctions against Azerbaijan, more support for Armenia

media:group.media:title: French parliament urges sanctions against Azerbaijan, more support for Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìçFrance‚Äôs National Assembly unanimously adopted a resolution calling for sanctions against Azerbaijan, among other provisions in support of Armenia. üìçArmenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan held talks with his Swiss, Czech, Greek, Lithuanian and Estonian counterparts in Poland on the sidelines of this year‚Äôs OSCE Ministerial Council. üìçRussian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov blamed the West for ‚Äúburying‚Äù the OSCE Minsk Group during a press conference, adding that the Karabakh status issue has been ‚Äúresolved.‚Äù
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Will Armenia be punished for the CSTO summit debacle?

media:group.media:title: Will Armenia be punished for the CSTO summit debacle?
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Insights with Eric Hacopian, Eric talks about the recent summit of the CSTO, a Russian-led military alliance, in Yerevan. Eric examines the possibility Armenia may face repercussions for refusing to sign a communique at the end of the summit, much to the dismay of the other CSTO leaders, including Vladimir Putin of Russia and Alexander Lukashenko of Belarus. Eric also gives his take on the ongoing protest movement in Iran and what it may lead to.

entry.title: Azerbaijan continues near daily ceasefire violations in Armenia and Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan continues near daily ceasefire violations in Armenia and Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan continues its near-daily violations of the ceasefire in both Armenia and Karabakh, as concerns grow that Baku may be preparing to launch another major attack. üìçThe U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee will hold hearings regarding the appointment of Kristina Kvien as the country‚Äôs next ambassador to Armenia. üìçThe number of Russians temporarily registering their places of residence in Armenia has increased fourfold year-on-year in the last three months, according to Armenia‚Äôs Police.

entry.title: 3 more opposition lawmakers resign from parliament

media:group.media:title: 3 more opposition lawmakers resign from parliament
media:group.media:description:
üìç2 Karabakh servicemen were injured after Azerbaijani forces violated the ceasefire, according to Karabakh‚Äôs Defense Ministry. üìçAn officer in the Armenian army was detained and charged with state treason after allegedly receiving $20,000 from a foreign government in exchange for his cooperation. üìç3 lawmakers from the Rebirth Armenia party, part of former President Robert Kocharyan‚Äôs Armenia Alliance bloc, announced they will be resigning from parliament.
